Package edu.cornell.gdiac.audio

Interface MusicQueue.OnTransitionListener

Enclosing interface:
MusicQueue
public static interface MusicQueue.OnTransitionListener
The interface for a callback invoked as the music queue is processed. This callback is more sophisticated than Music.OnCompletionListener in that it is not limited to the end of the music stream. It also notifies us when we transition from one track to another. All of these methods are conservative. When streaming audio there is a delay between when the audio is queued to the audio card and when it is processed. All of these callback methods are only called when the various events are processed, confirming that they did indeed happen. For a less conservative approach, you should get the current position in the queue.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    onCompletion(MusicQueue buffer, AudioSource source)
    Called when the end of a music stream is reached during playback.
    void
    onLoopback(MusicQueue buffer, AudioSource source)
    Called when a single audio source loops back around.
    void
    onTransition(MusicQueue buffer, AudioSource source1, AudioSource source2)
    Called when queue transitions from one source to another.

  • Method Details

    • onLoopback

      void onLoopback(MusicQueue buffer, AudioSource source)
      Called when a single audio source loops back around. This callback is conservative. Is called when the loop around has been processed (and has likely started playing already). For a less conservative approach, you should get the current position in the queue.
      Parameters:
      buffer - The buffer that reached the end of the stream
      source - The source that looped around

    • onTransition

      void onTransition(MusicQueue buffer, AudioSource source1, AudioSource source2)
      Called when queue transitions from one source to another. This callback is conservative. Is called when the second source has been processed (and has likely started playing already). For a less conservative approach, you should get the current position in the queue.
      Parameters:
      buffer - The buffer that reached the end of the stream
      source1 - The previous source in the transition
      source2 - The current source in the transition

    • onCompletion

      void onCompletion(MusicQueue buffer, AudioSource source)
      Called when the end of a music stream is reached during playback. This callback is conservative. Is called when the source has completely finished playing, not when it has been queued up (this distinction matters for gapless playback). For a less conservative approach, you should get the current position in the queue.
      Parameters:
      buffer - The buffer that reached the end of the stream
      source - The last source processed by this stream
